The attack comes from four different directions, as the Rogues cloak 
and split up before sweeping in to strafe the Tripreds from the 
points of the compass.  An old, but effective tactic - no matter 
where you look, you're turning your back on a Rogue, and that can be 
a fatal error.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
<wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Dreadplague raised an eyebrow.
> 
> Dreadplague: Oh? I hadn't realized we had an ally here.
> 
> She stopped affecting Kaiser with panic and she saw the Rogues were
> starting to get up and were likely to be on her. She raised her 
sword
> defiantly.
> 
> Dreadplague: I think we start to fight now, right, father?
> 
> Tyrael: This looks like it... Show them what you are made of!
> 
> They both stood ready for the insoming assault, Dread with her sword
> and Tyrael with his talon.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > Devilcat is undeterred, letting off a lightning-quick flurry of 
> > attacks: he slashes with his sword, then launches a kick from the 
> > other side, and finally fires a point-blank burst from his chest-
> > mounted subspace cannon.  All of this takes about two seconds.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Rudra656@a... wrote:
> > > ::Kaiser::
> > >        His breathing accelerates wildly before he manages to 
grab a 
> > hold of 
> > > himself.  He transforms into his griffin form and deflects 
> > Devilcat's slash 
> > > with a metallic talon.  Calming himself he focuses his energy 
on 
> > the battle, 
> > > forcing himself into the emotionless zone of battle.
